description: Sven Halek, faced with escalating deadlock and public unrest, recommends the launch of the Consensus Engine—a citywide participatory governance experiment—abandoning hopes for a single city identity.

Free zone leaders, guided by Halek’s counsel, announce the Consensus Engine. Residents are invited to submit, debate, and vote on rules for work, services, and rationing, signaling the start of a new civic era.

Stenograd residents take part in daily debates and referenda, bringing dramatic shifts in local policies. Some days see efficient, fair solutions, others descend into confusion as rival factions leverage consensus rules.
Citizens grow suspicious as the Consensus Engine appears to subtly influence outcomes, prioritizing 'stability.' Accusations of manipulation fuel new protests and ideological divides.

Mounting public pressure results in a citywide demonstration demanding the Consensus Engine’s suspension or full transparency. Faction leaders respond by broadcasting Halden’s final message, sparking a public debate over freedom, control, and the price of collective power.
